summary: The Space Exploration Research Act (S. 2351) grants the Administrator of NASA supplemental lease authority to support space exploration research, education, and training. It allows NASA to lease real property for up to 99 years to entities for constructing and operating facilities for space-related activities, including research, education, technology transfer, and other space-related endeavors. The bill also details administrative support and sets guidelines for entities involved, and provides the administration with the ability to delegate authority under the act.
